title: Peru: Citi Announces the Opening of the Seventh Annual Citi Microenterprise Award, PREMIC 2012
summary: Lima, Peru - Citibank Peru, a leading participant in the Peruvian financial system with more than 92 years of uninterrupted presence in the market, announced today the seventh edition of the Citi Microenterprise Award, PREMIC 2012, in partnership with IPAE Acción Empresarial and the Citi Foundation.
tag-1: Peru: Citi Announces the Opening of the Seventh Annual Citi Microenterprise Award, PREMIC 2012
tag-3: Lima, Peru – Citibank Peru, a leading participant in the Peruvian financial system with more than 92 years of uninterrupted presence in the market, announced today the seventh edition of the Citi Microenterprise Award, PREMIC 2012, in partnership with IPAE Acción Empresarial and the Citi Foundation.
tag-4: The award is designed to contribute to the development of microenterprise and promote microfinance as an essential element for growth and sustainability in a segment that represents some 98 percent of companies in Peru and 65 percent of the nation's jobs.
tag-5: The PREMIC 2012 Award is oriented toward formal microenterprises with a credit history with microfinance institutions. These institutions may nominate award candidates from July 18 through October 5.
tag-6: As in previous years, the PREMIC 2012 Award will present special recognition in the Commercial, Production and Services categories, in addition to a special prize for innovation. A total of US$ 36,000 will be awarded to enable microenterprise managers to further their businesses. For the very first time, an award will also be presented to the most innovative financial institution for recognizing ideas that go beyond traditional microcredit, either through products, new distribution channels or financial education that contributes in some way to creating significant improvement for clients in this particular segment.
tag-7: The financial institution that wins this award will receive two scholarships to participate in the renowned Microfinance Training Program for Latin America and the Caribbean, Boulder MFT, to be offered in Colombia by the Boulder Institute of Microfinance during first quarter 2013.
tag-8: Awards such as PREMIC 2012 are vital for the country, given Peru's No. 3 ranking among countries with the most early entrepreneurial activity, after China and Chile, according to the Global Entrepreneurship Monitor 2011 report.
tag-9: José Antonio Blanco, President of the Board and GM for Citibank Peru, says that the development of microenterprises generates sustainability and reduces poverty for families around the country. He notes: "Citibank Peru has a great responsibility towards the communities it operates in, and for this reason we are certain that supporting microenterprises contributes to poverty reduction in the country while further supporting social and financial inclusion."
tag-10: The PREMIC Award is presented in 27 countries. This is the seventh year it has been offered in Peru. Terms and conditions for the award may be downloaded at www.premic.com.pe and presented at authorized branch locations or scanned and emailed as an attachment to inscripciones@premic.com.pe.
tag-11: As in previous years, PREMIC 2012 will include the participation of other industry organizations, including the Association of Microfinance Institutions of Peru (ASOMIF) and the Municipal Savings and Loans Municipal Federation (FEPCMAC), to promote the role of microfinance. This year's competition also welcomes the AVINA Foundation, which aims to contribute to sustainable development in Latin America by encouraging and strengthening links and partnerships between social and business leaders.
tag-12: Finally, and as is the case every year, the PREMIC 2012 Award will benefit from the participation of highly trained and specialized jury members who have come together to select the most outstanding cases and situations. The award is expected to be one of the year's leading microenterprise recognition events.
tag-13: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-15: Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
tag-16: IPAE Acción Empresarial IPAE Accion Empresarial is an institution with more than 50 years of experience working to strengthen and promote education and business in Peru, focusing citizens' efforts towards development.
